page.title: 08CRANLEIGH HEALTH SERVICES
page.content: {The Health Centre} The Health Centre is in the middle of the village. It has surgeries for six doctors. District nurses help old people and invalids by visiting their homes. Classes are held for expectant mothers. New babies are visited at home while older babies and toddlers are seen at a special clinic. On other days, school eye doctors,school dentists and speech therapists hold clinics. Old people with bad feet can see a chiropodist. {The school nurse} { }The school nurse is responsible for 13 schools and she looks after some 2,500 children. She attends all school medical examinations and is able to offer advice to families. She tests eyesight, checks hair for nits and holds a foot clinic to treat verrucae.
